solution.text:
We have a combination of triangle and a circle
Area of the dotted region= Area of the circle + Area (PQRS)
Area of the dotted region= Area of the circle + [area of the triangle - area of the sector(ORS)]
As QOP is an equilateral triangle, all the angles of the triangle = \(60^\circ\)
we get angle subtended by the sector ROS at the centre \(=\theta =\angle QOP=60^\circ\)
Area of the sector = \(\pi \times R^2 \times \frac{60}{360}= _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/6,2)}}_\)
Area of the equilateral triangle\(=\frac {\sqrt 3}{4} \times PO^2 \Rightarrow_{{trunc(Decimal('1.732')*j*j,2)}}_\)
Area of the circle\(= _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j,2)}}_\)
Area of the dotted region= Area of the circle + [area of the triangle - area of the sector(ORS)]
\(\Rightarrow dotted \,area= _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j,2)}}_ + [_{{trunc(Decimal('1.732')*j*j,2)}}_ - _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/6,2)}}_]\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j+Decimal('1.732')*j*j-pi_val*j*j/6,2)}}_\)
